session_summary: Joanna and Nate caught up on January 23, 2022, at 2:01 pm. Joanna excitedly shared that she had completed her first screenplay, a mix of drama and romance, and planned to submit it to film festivals. Nate congratulated her and mentioned his turtles, recommending pets for stress relief. Joanna, allergic to animals with fur and reptiles, shared her joy for writing and hanging out with friends. Nate praised her passion for writing, and Joanna expressed her commitment to continue pursuing it. Nate also mentioned making new friends at a tournament.

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Hey Nate! Haven't talked in a few days. Crazy things happened to me!

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Hi Joanna! Long time no see! What's been going on? You sound excited!

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of a book with a page of text on it
conversation_turns.text: Woo! I finally finished my first full screenplay and printed it last Friday. I've been working on for a while, such a relief to have it all done!

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Wow, that sounds awesome! What's it about? Glad it's all down!

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Thanks, Nate! It's a mix of drama and romance!

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Wow, that's amazing! How do you feel now that it's finished? Do you have any new plans for it?

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Woohoo, Nate! I'm feeling a rollercoaster of emotions - relief, excitement, some anxiety - over finishing this project. Now I'm gonna submit it to some film festivals and (hopefully) get producers and directors to check it out. Here's hoping!

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Congrats, Joanna! That sounds like a wild experience. Rock on and I hope they love it!

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Thanks Nate! A mix of emotions for sure. Hopefully, it leads to positive feedback and new opportunities.

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.blip_caption: a photography of a turtle and a turtleling sitting on a rock
conversation_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. Hoping for the best! I like having some of these little ones around to keep me calm when things are super important and I'm nervous.

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Awww! How long have you had them?

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: I've had them for 3 years now and they bring me tons of joy!

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: They sure lookl like they do! Adorable!

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Thanks! The turtles might be small, but both sure have big personalities. I really reccomend having something like these little guys for times of stress.

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Good idea, Nate! I'll think about it and maybe get pets of my own soon if I can find any I'm not allergic to. Have you been up to anything recently?

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Yeah actually! I start to hang out with some people outside of my circle at the tournament. They're pretty cool!

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Oh? That sounds sweet! Is it a weird relationship with them being competitors and all?

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Oh, kind of. Some people are more competitive then others, so I tend to just stick around the more chill people here.

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: That makes sense! Are you gonna cheer them on even if you lose?

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Absolutely! I don't expect to win big here, I just like playing for fun!  You mentioned you were allergic to pets earlier, how bad is it?

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Oh, its really bad. My face gets all puffy and itchy when I'm around certain animals, so I've always just stayed away.

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Sorry to hear that. Allergies can be tough. What specifically are you allergic to?

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: I'm allergic to most reptiles and animals with fur. It can be a bit of a drag, but I find other ways to be happy.

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Awesome! There are lots of things that can bring you joy without pets. What else brings you joy?

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Writing and hanging with friends! That way I can express myself through stories, or just have a good time with people.

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: That's great to hear! Those are both great things. I'm glad to hear you've got other things to help you get through times of axiousness despite not being able to have animals!

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Thanks, Nate! Writing helps me create wild worlds with awesome characters. Plus, it's a great way to express my feelings. I can't imagine life without it.

conversation_turns.speaker: Nate
conversation_turns.text: Wow, Joanna, that sounds amazing! Keep doing what you love!

conversation_turns.speaker: Joanna
conversation_turns.text: Thanks, Nate! I'll definitely keep pursuing my passion for writing. It means a lot.

Joanna: Joanna finishes writing her first full screenplay on drama and romance and plans on submitting it to a film festival so that producers and directors can check it out.
Nate: Nate starts hanging out with new people he met from outside his circle at the Counter Strike tournament.

Joanna: Joanna finished her first full screenplay last Friday, which is a mix of drama and romance.
Joanna plans to submit her screenplay to film festivals and hopes to attract producers and directors to check it out.
Joanna is allergic to most reptiles and animals with fur, causing her face to get puffy and itchy.
Writing and hanging out with friends bring Joanna joy and help her express herself.
Writing allows Joanna to create wild worlds with interesting characters and serves as a great way to express her feelings.
Nate: Nate has had turtles for 3 years that bring him joy and help keep him calm during stressful times.
Nate enjoys hanging out with people outside of his usual circle at the tournament.
Nate tends to stick around more chill people at the tournament due to varying levels of competitiveness.
Nate does not expect to win big at the tournament but plays for fun and likes cheering on others.
